div.l: To yeue hem Leue but a litle stounde
To goo to the mylle ⁊and se their corn grounde
And hardely they durste ley their necke
The miller shold not stele halfe a pecke
Of corne by sleight or by force hem tene
And at the laste the warden yaue hēm leue
Iohn hight that one ⁊and Aleyne hight that othir
Of a toun were they borne that hight strodir
Fer in the North I cannot telle where
They maken redy al her owne gere
And on the hors the sackes cast anone
Forth goth Aleyne the clerke and eke Iohn
Wᵗith good swerde and bokeler by her side
Iohn knowe the wey hym neded no gyde
And at the mylle the sak adoun he leith
Alayn spake firste al hail Symond in feith
Howe faryth thy feire doughter and thy wiff
Aleyne welcome quod Symkyn be my lyff
And Iohn also whate howe what do ye here
Symond quoth he be god nede hath no pere
Hym bus serue hym selfe that hath no swayn
Or elles he is a foole as clerkes seyn
Our Manciple I hope he wolle be dede
Swa wordes ay there wanges in his hede
And therfore I is come and this Aleyn
To grynde oure corne and cary it ageyn
I pᵃray you spede vs heyn in that ye may
Hit shalbe do quod Symkyn be my fay
Whate wille ye do whiles it is in honde
Be god right be the hopir wolle I stonde
Quod Iohn and se howe the corn gos yn
Yet sawe I nevir be my fadir kyn
Howe the hopir wagges to and fro
